intro: Antirrhinum vidalianum, commonly known as the Vidalian snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous flowers along the upper part of the stem. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to retain moisture in dry conditions. Antirrhinum vidalianum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and public landscapes.
